Dar al-Athar al-Islamiyyah (DAI) is a cultural organization based around the private art collection.

The project objectives are to train Kuwaitis to become professional museum and laboratories employees in the preservation and display of selected artefacts from the Dar Al-Athar Al-Islamiyyah collection at the Kuwait National Museum.

Based on the increasing incidence of violence amongst youth, this project is intended as a response to foster the resiliency of young people to encourage healthy lifestyles and reduce violence and risky activities.

title.narrative: 2013 Annual Progress Report - Fostering Youth Resiliency

description.narrative: To response to the increasing incidences of violence among school-age youth, with an ultimate goal of decreasing the dysfunctional behaviors,by encouraging more healthy lifestyles through self-awareness, and social skills enhancement.

title.narrative: Support to Public Authority of Manpower

description.narrative: PAM is partnering with UNDP, IOM& ILO to improve the labor conditions. This prog aims to support PAM to develop internal capacity in reporting on its own performance, on labor movement & on compliance with int'l labor standards.

title.narrative: Support to Public Authority of Manpower

description.narrative: PAM plans to improve the labour conditions and management system by analysing the demographic imbalance, making sound decision based on enhanced reporting mechanisms and upgrading its services quality for all economic and social actors.

The ICDI/KNDP project seeks to provide a framework of technical support to GSSCPD and CSB and other public entities to create an enabling environment for implementation, monitoring and evaluation and ultimately delivery of KNDP results.

The project seeks to provide a framework for technical support to Ministry of Electricity and Water (MEW), to ensure implementation of new public energy schemes applying energy efficiency procedures to reduce energy consumption in Kuwait.
